frame.name: Type
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame has to do with nouns denoting types of entities. The <fen>Subtype</fen> refers to a collection of members of a more general <fen>Category</fen> which have certain defining characteristics; alternatively, the <fen>Subtype</fen> refers only to the type itself, i.e. a more restrictive set of characteristics than those of the more general <fen>Category</fen>. The properties of the items that are included in the collection may be specified by the <fen>Item_Property</fen>. Sometimes the <fen>Subtype</fen>s themselves are described by some <fen>Type_Property</fen>.
<ex>I don't like this <fex name="Type_Property">newfangled</fex> <t><fex name="Subtype">kind</fex></t> <fex name="Category">of fish</fex>.</ex> <ex>Kleo isn't <fex name="Item_Property">our</fex> <t><fex name="Subtype">sort</fex></t> <fex name="Category">of people</fex>.</ex> <ex>He argued against the <fex name="Item_Property">formalist</fex> <t><fex name="Subtype">type</fex></t> <fex name="Category">of analysis of art</fex>.</ex> <ex>I think that she was referring to the other <t><fex name="Subtype">type</fex></t>. <fex name="Category">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subtype
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which denotes a subtype of the more general <fen>Category</fen>. <ex>I don't like this <t><fex name="Subtype">kind</fex></t> of fish.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Category
FE.definition:
<def-root>The more general type that the target denotes a subtype of. This FE is obligatory and should be labeled DNI when not present.
<ex>They created a new <t>breed</t> <fex name="Category">of dog</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Type_property
FE.definition:
<def-root>A property of the <fen>Subtype</fen> itself rather than the members of the <fen>Category</fen>.
<ex>I tried a <fex name="Type_property">new</fex> <t>type</t> of hair gel yesterday.</ex>
Many <fen>Type_property</fen> adjectives (e.g. new, rare, traditional, modern, strange) make explicit that the type under discussion is just one of the types in the more general <fen>Category</fen>. Adjectives that denote properties of items in the category should be tagged <fen>Item_property</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Item_property
FE.definition:
<def-root>A property of the members of the <fen>Category</fen> that helps identify (directly or indirectly) the particular set of members that are referred to by the <fen>Subtype</fen>.
<ex>He had a <fex name="Item_property">Bon Jovi</fex> <t>kind</t> of guitar.</ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: type.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a category of people or things having common characteristics

lexUnit.name: class.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a category of things having some property in common and different from others by type or quality

lexUnit.name: kind.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a class or type of people or things having similar characteristics

lexUnit.name: sort.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a category of people or things with a common feature

lexUnit.name: variety.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thing which differs in some way from others of the same general class; a type.

lexUnit.name: strain.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a distinct breed, stock, or variety of an animal, plant, or other organism

lexUnit.name: breed.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a sort or kind, esp. a distinctive stock of animals or plants within a species, typically one deliberately developed

lexUnit.name: make.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a specific line of goods as identified by the manufacturer or a trademark

lexUnit.name: race.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: each of the major divisions of humankind, having distinct physical characteristics.

lexUnit.name: brand.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a type of product that is characterized in terms of the people or company that manufactured it

lexUnit.name: form.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a type or variety of something.

lexUnit.name: shade.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a subtype or specific value (of a color).

lexUnit.name: version.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a particular form of something differing in certain respects from an earlier form or from other forms of the same type of thing.
